intro: Caraipa densifolia subsp. densifolia, commonly known as the denseleaf caraipa, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical with a prominent midrib and are covered in fine, soft hairs. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
